ProjectTitle: Directing tissue folding and morphogenesis in neural tube organoids.
InitialFeedbackHistory:
06/07/2022
2. Data: Please also list samples and cell lines, these are your physical data; are you collecting any other datasets, code/scripts or numerical data related to analyses for example? Are you measuring anything else, gene expression, protein levels etc? 
3. Ethics: Are you using human cells or other human bodily material? Please note these fall under the scope of the biobank law and you need approval from the UZL ethical committee to use these, for more information and how to apply see: www.kuleuven.be/english/research/associatienet/ethics/guidance/humanmaterial
7. Sharing: Instead of Zenodo you can also use KU Leuven RDR (www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr), or maybe IRD (https://idr.openmicroscopy.org/) is more suitable for your kind of data?
label: good with suggestions
